intro: Huperzia polaris, commonly known as the polar huperzia, is a species of moss-like plant belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its small, compact growth form and its ability to thrive in cold, moist environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with dark green, wiry stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. It is often found in arctic and alpine regions, where it contributes to the unique flora of these ecosystems. Huperzia polaris plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native habitats.
